com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.SequenceGraph.SequencePropertyRetriever
      • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PairedReads
    Enclosing class:
    SequenceViewerExtension

    public abstract static class SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor
extends SequenceGraph.SequencePropertyRetriever
    Provides methods for querying the sequence viewer about the status of various things and for requesting that the sequence viewer change its state. Only the Sequence Viewer should implement this class. Other plugins should never implement it.

    A plugin may instantiate a SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor for testing purposes using PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.forAlignment or PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.forSequences.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback
      Used for indicating that references to values returned from PropertyRetrieverAndEditor#getVisibleAnnotations(PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback) must be discarded.

      • getAnnotatedPluginDocument

        public abstract AnnotatedPluginDocument getAnnotatedPluginDocument(int sequenceIndex)
        Get the current AnnotatedPluginDocument of one of the sequences being viewed. Does not include any unsaved changes.
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the index of the sequence in question whose AnnotatedPluginDocument we should return
        Returns:
        the AnnotatedPluginDocument

      • getVisibleAnnotations

        public List<SequenceViewerExtension.SequenceAnnotationWrapper> getVisibleAnnotations(SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback discardReferencesCallback)
        Gets all currently visible (after applying the filter) annotations. This method may only be called from the swing thread. If the calling code wants to refer to these annotations after returning control to the swing thread (for example from a background thread or even from a later invocation of a method on the swing thread) then it must provide a non-null value for discardReferencesCallback
        Parameters:
        discardReferencesCallback - may be null if the caller will not hold a reference to any of the annotations after returning control to the swing thread. The calling code should reuse the same instance of this callback to avoid excessive listeners building up
        Returns:
        all currently visible (after applying the filter) annotations

      • getSelectedAnnotations

        public List<SequenceViewerExtension.SequenceAnnotationWrapper> getSelectedAnnotations()
        Gets all currently selected annotations. This method may only be called from the swing thread.
        Returns:
        all currently selected annotations

      • getPreferencesSuffix

        public String getPreferencesSuffix()
        Returns a preference suffix describing the classes of the current documents being viewed. The sequence viewer uses this to store independent preference sets for different classes of documents. For example there are different preference suffixes for nucleotide/amino acid sequences, single/multiple sequences, genome sized sequences/small sequences, contigs and alignments.
        Returns:
        a preference suffix describing the current documents being viewed.

      • setSelectedAnnotations

        public boolean setSelectedAnnotations(List<SequenceViewerExtension.SequenceAnnotationWrapper> selectedAnnotations)
        Sets the selected annotations

        This method may only be invoked from the Swing thread

        Parameters:
        selectedAnnotations - the annotations to select. These must be a subset of annotations returned from a previous call to #getVisibleAnnotations(PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback)
        Returns:
        true if the annotations were successfully selected.

      • editSelectedAnnotations

        public boolean editSelectedAnnotations()
        Opens the annotation editing dialog for the currently selected annotations.

        This method may only be invoked from the Swing thread

        Returns:
        true if the dialog was displayed. false if not (for example the document or individual annotations are not editable)

      • getUngappedIndexOfThisOrNextResidue

        public abstract int getUngappedIndexOfThisOrNextResidue(int sequenceIndex,
                                      int residueIndex,
                                      boolean waitForResultIfUnavailable,
                                      SimpleListener resultAvailableListener)
        Converts a gapped index in a sequence into the equivalent ungapped index. Equivalent to SequenceGapInformation.getUngappedIndexOfThisOrNextResidue(int).

        If this is used on unaligned sequences, then residueIndex is returned.

        This method should either be invoked from the Swing thread, or by an extension that has registered a SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback and has not been instructed to discard references.

        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the 0-based index of the sequence to get the value for. -1 represents the consensus sequence, although using this on the consensus sequence is not recommended due to the entire consensus sequence needing to be evaluated (which can take a long time)
        residueIndex - the 0-based gapped position within the sequence
        waitForResultIfUnavailable - true to block until the result is available.
        resultAvailableListener - an optional listener to notify when the result is probably available in which case the calling code should call this method again. Only used if waitForResultIfUnavailable==false
        Returns:
        the ungapped index, or Integer.MIN_VALUE if the result is not quickly available and waitForResultIfUnavailable==false
        See Also:
        SequenceGapInformation.getUngappedIndexOfThisOrNextResidue(int), getUngappedIndexOfThisOrPreviousResidue(int, int, boolean, org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener)

      • getUngappedIndexOfThisOrPreviousResidue

        public abstract int getUngappedIndexOfThisOrPreviousResidue(int sequenceIndex,
                                          int residueIndex,
                                          boolean waitForResultIfUnavailable,
                                          SimpleListener resultAvailableListener)
        Converts a gapped index in a sequence into the equivalent ungapped index. Equivalent to SequenceGapInformation.getUngappedIndexOfThisOrPreviousResidue(int)

        If this is used on unaligned sequences, then residueIndex is returned.

        This method should either be invoked from the Swing thread, or by an extension that has registered a SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback and has not been instructed to discard references.

        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the 0-based index of the sequence to get the value for. -1 represents the consensus sequence, although using this on the consensus sequence is not recommended due to the entire consensus sequence needing to be evaluated (which can take a long time)
        residueIndex - the 0-based gapped position within the sequence
        waitForResultIfUnavailable - true to block until the result is available.
        resultAvailableListener - an optional listener to notify when the result is probably available in which case the calling code should call this method again. Only used if waitForResultIfUnavailable==false
        Returns:
        the ungapped index, or Integer.MIN_VALUE if the result is not quickly available and waitForResultIfUnavailable==false
        See Also:
        SequenceGapInformation.getUngappedIndexOfThisOrNextResidue(int), getUngappedIndexOfThisOrPreviousResidue(int, int, boolean, org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener)

      • getUngappedIndexFromExtractedRegion

        public abstract int getUngappedIndexFromExtractedRegion(int sequenceIndex,
                                      int residueIndex,
                                      boolean waitForResultIfUnavailable,
                                      SimpleListener resultAvailableListener)
        Converts a gapped index to a sequence into the equivalent ungapped index, and then further adjusts the index to account for any SequenceAnnotation.TYPE_EXTRACTED_REGION annotation covering the position

        This method should either be invoked from the Swing thread, or by an extension that has registered a SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback and has not been instructed to discard references.

        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the 0-based index of the sequence to get the value for. -1 represents the consensus sequence, although using this on the consensus sequence is not recommended due to the entire consensus sequence needing to be evaluated (which can take a long time)
        residueIndex - the 0-based gapped position within the sequence
        waitForResultIfUnavailable - true to block until the result is available.
        resultAvailableListener - an optional listener to notify when the result is probably available in which case the calling code should call this method again. Only used if waitForResultIfUnavailable==false
        Returns:
        the ungapped and extraction adjusted index, or or Integer.MIN_VALUE if the result is not quickly available and waitForResultIfUnavailable==false

      • getGappedIndex

        public abstract int getGappedIndex(int sequenceIndex,
                 int residueIndex,
                 boolean waitForResultIfUnavailable,
                 SimpleListener resultAvailableListener)
        Converts an ungapped index to a sequence into the equivalent gapped index. Equivalent to SequenceGapInformation.getGappedIndex(int)

        This method should either be invoked from the Swing thread, or by an extension that has registered a SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor.DiscardReferencesCallback and has not been instructed to discard references.

        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the 0-based index of the sequence to get the value for. -1 represents the consensus sequence, although using this on the consensus sequence is not recommended due to the entire consensus sequence needing to be evaluated (which can take a long time)
        residueIndex - the 0-based ungapped position within the sequence
        waitForResultIfUnavailable - true to block until the result is available.
        resultAvailableListener - an optional listener to notify when the result is probably available in which case the calling code should call this method again. Only used if waitForResultIfUnavailable==false
        Returns:
        the gapped index, or or Integer.MIN_VALUE if the result is not quickly available and waitForResultIfUnavailable==false

        Returns:
        true if the SequenceViewer is an alignment or contig view instead of an unaligned sequence view.

      • getNumberOfTracks

        public int getNumberOfTracks(int sequenceIndex)
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the 0-based index of the sequence. This is only applicable on alignment based graphs. This must be 0 on sequence based graphs.
        Returns:
        the number of tracks (see SequenceTrack on this sequence.
        Since:
        API 4.61 (Geneious 5.6.1)

      • getTrackName

        public String getTrackName(int sequenceIndex,
                  int trackIndex)
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the 0-based index of the sequence. This is only applicable on alignment based graphs. This must be 0 on sequence based graphs.
        trackIndex - the 0-based index of the track (in the range 0 to getNumberOfTracks(int). May be -1 to get the name of the non-track which is null.
        Returns:
        the name of a track (see SequenceTrack on this sequence or null if this is not a track (i.e. the trackIndex is -1)
        Since:
        API 4.61 (Geneious 5.6.1)

      • isDedicatedExtensionViewer

        public boolean isDedicatedExtensionViewer()
        Returns:
        true if this sequence viewer is dedicated to only showing a single sequence viewer extension. As of Geneious 5.7, only the annotations viewer extension can do this.
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • getSelection

        public abstract SequenceSelection getSelection()
        Returns:
        the currently selected regions. This will never be null, but may a selection containing no intervals if nothing is selected, or maybe contain intervals of 0 length if the cursor is positioned somewhere
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)
        See Also:
        getSelectionForStatistics(), getSelectionForAlignmentStatistics()

      • getSelectionForStatistics

        public abstract SequenceSelection getSelectionForStatistics()
        Returns:
        A region similar to the current selection but suitable for generating statistics on. This is the currently selected regions or a region covering everything (consensus excluded) if nothing is selected or if the cursor is just positioned somewhere. This will never be null. Alignment based statistics should use getSelectionForAlignmentStatistics() instead.
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)
        See Also:
        getSelection(), getSelectionForAlignmentStatistics()

      • getSelectionForAlignmentStatistics

        public abstract Map<Interval,List<Interval>> getSelectionForAlignmentStatistics()
        Returns an adjusted selection suitable for statistics that take alignments into account.

        Each key in the map represents a range of columns in the alignment which should be treated independantly of each other range of columns. The map value(list of intervals) associated with each map value (range of columns) represents the sequences that are selected for that range of columns.

        For example a Map of 0->5: (0->2), (4->5) indicates that columns 0 to 4 (inclusive) are selected in sequences 0, 1 and 4.

        The sequence viewer has already adjusted this from the real selection the user made, to instead choose suitable intervals for alignment statistics. For example if nothing is selected, or if just a single sequence is selected then a selection equivalent to the whole alignment will be returned.

        Most implementations should check if the alignment should not calculate statistics for large contigs (where getSequenceListSummary()!=null)

        Implementations should take into account whether or not it is a free end gap alignment using SequenceGraph.SequencePropertyRetriever.isFreeEndGapAlignment() and handle circular alignments by wrapping positions at SequenceGraph.SequencePropertyRetriever.getCircularAlignmentLength()

        Returns:
        a list of selected regions suitable for statistics that alignments into account.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if isAlignmentOrContig()==false
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)
        See Also:
        getSelection(), getSelectionForStatistics()

      • forSequences

        public static SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor forSequences(SequenceDocument... sequences)
        Creates a SequencePropertyRetriever for a list of sequences. This should be used for testing purposes only. In production situations, a property retriever is supplied to sequence viewer extension plugins when they are created via SequenceViewerExtension.Factory.createSequenceViewerExtension or SequenceViewerExtension.StatisticsFactory.createStatistics.
        Parameters:
        sequences - the sequences to create a properties retriever for.
        Returns:
        a newly created properties retriever.
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)

      • forAlignment

        public static SequenceViewerExtension.PropertyRetrieverAndEditor forAlignment(SequenceAlignmentDocument alignment)
        Creates a SequencePropertyRetriever for an alignment. This should be used for testing purposes only. In production situations, a property retriever is supplied to sequence viewer extension plugins when they are created via SequenceViewerExtension.Factory.createSequenceViewerExtension or SequenceViewerExtension.StatisticsFactory.createStatistics.
        Parameters:
        alignment - the alignment to create a properties retriever for.
        Returns:
        a newly created properties retriever.
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)
